intro: Pectis densa, commonly known as the dense pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Pectis densa is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
